hero.title: Agri-Challenge Accelerator
hero.description:
Catalyzing Innovation Across Agri-Value Chains Through Real-World Pilots
The Agri-Challenge Accelerator supports early-stage ventures solving critical challenges across Uganda's agricultural value chains. Through startup-corporate collaboration, the program enables ventures to pilot, validate, and commercialize innovations that improve productivity, resilience, and market access for smallholder farmers and agri-enterprises.Working with partners like Highland Innovation Hub, Bunyonyi Distributors Ltd (BDL) and other ecosystem actors, the Agri-challenge accelerator facilitates proof-of-concept pilots in real operating environments to address long-standing inefficiencies in the agricultural system.

list: Corporate pilot partners to co-design and run PoC pilots with real users
Farmers, cooperatives, and processors for product validation
Mentorship from leading founders and technical advisors
Support toward commercialization and investment readiness

quote.text: We designed this accelerator not just to support startups, but to validate the solutions that can truly transform how agri-value chains work across East Africa.

hero.title: Zida Franchise Accelerator
hero.description: Equips ambitious SMEs in Uganda with the tools, mentorship, and market access needed to transition from a thriving local business to a scalable franchise network.

businessesGet.title: What Businesses Get
items: A fully developed franchise blueprint tailored to your business.
An investable business plan and operational toolkit.
1-on-1 mentorship with experts in franchising, finance, operations, and marketing.
Exposure visits and learning exchanges with advanced franchise operators.
Ongoing access to an expert WhatsApp support group.
Connections to potential investors and franchisees.

selectionCriteria.title: Selection Criteria
items: Profitable and have attempted scaling (e.g., opened additional branches).
Operationally mature with defined SOPs or systems in place.
Backed by a strong brand identity and customer following.
Led by founders committed to franchising as a growth pathway.
Willing and able to invest time and resources into the pilot.
Equipped with historical data (2+ years) and clear growth goals.
